                                                                    Patient Portal Login(opens in new window)Org Chart (PDF)After Hours CareFor after hours care please go to Enloe Medical Center(opens in new window)located at 1531 Esplanade, Chico, CA 95926 or call 530-332-7300.For emergency care, please call 911.For non emergency care you may also go to Enloe Prompt Care(opens in new window)located at 888 Lakeside Village Commons, Chico CA 95926 or call 530-332-6850, open from 8:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m.National Suicide Prevention Lifeline 1-800-273-8255Crisis support(opens in new window) is offered in conjunction with our partners at the WellCat Counseling Center(opens in new window)Reviewed: February 2, 2022 - Information subject to change.Current page:  healthcenter
                                        
    		WellCat Health Center
    	
                        Introducing TimelyCare!
                    Hey there, WildCats! Have you heard about our new TimelyCare service? TimelyCare is a free, 24/7 virtual health care service available for all Chico State students who have paid their student health fee. Check out our TimelyCare page for more information!
                        WellCat Health Center Operations During COVID
                    Face coverings are required for the duration of your visit to the WellCat Health Center. If you do not have a face covering, one will be provided for you. Accessing the WellCat Health Center during COVID-19WellCat Health Center is open by appointment only (no walk-ins).Students are able to book appointments by calling the WellCat Health Center at 530-898-5241, or by web booking an appointment through the patient portal. Web Booking is available through our Patient Portal for the following symptoms:Cough, congestion, fever, body aches, sore throatEar or eye issue/painRash/Skin issuesFamily Pact EnrollmentAccessing Pharmacy ServicesThe WellCat Health Center Pharmacy is open for prescription and over-the-counter medication pick up, Monday through Friday during clinic hours. No appointment is necessary.If you are in need of a refill for an existing prescription, please request a prescription refill from the Pharmacy through Messages via the Patient Portal. If you are not currently in the area, your prescription can be transferred to an outside pharmacy.Some services are available remotely by request:Prescription ConsultationTransfer of PrescriptionsRefill to Outside PharmacyWhat to Expect When You ArriveBring your student ID and face covering to your appointment. Face coverings are required for the duration of your visit to the WellCat Health Center.Be prepared to arrive 15 minutes prior to your appointment if you are being seen in person.Parking is available in the WCHC Patient Parking spaces; parking permits are required for patients using clinic services. Please let us know at the time of your visit if you need a permit. You will be met at the door and asked to confirm you are here for an appointment. You will be asked to don your face covering prior to entering the building. If you do not have one, one will be made available to you.Once you are brought in to the building, you will be directed to sanitize your hands and will be escorted to a window to check in.Once you have checked in, you will be directed where to go next.Please note: at this time, the WellCat Health Center is limiting visitors to the health center to patients with an appointment only. Anyone who arrives with you for your appointment will be asked to wait outside the clinic until your appointment is done.COVID-19 Vaccine & TestingAt this time, the WCHC is not able to administer the COVID-19 vaccine or booster. Please visit My Turn-CDPH(opens in new window) to find a vaccination site near you.The WCHC offers COVID-19 testing for currently enrolled students who may be experiencing symptoms. Please call our clinic at 530-898-5241 for further information. Please call the COVID-19 Hotline at 530-898-2222 if you are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms, have had close contact with someone who testing positive for COVID-19, or have tested positive for COVID-19.If you are in need of surveillance testing, please visit the list of testing sites in Butte County. (PDF)Reviewed: March 7th, 2022 - Information subject to change.

                        Patient Satisfaction Survey 
                    Did you know?Students can request a prescription refill or send a secure message to a provider through the student portal.Tips for a Successful VisitArrive Early - You must arrive 15 minutes prior to an appointment. Arriving late will result in cancellation.Bring Your ID - make sure you have a legible student ID with you.Avoid $25 No-Show Fee - if you can’t make it, please call to cancel to avoid the no-show fee.Need to make an Appointment now? We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
